title: General Training Set 19 — Volunteer Fair & Four-day Weeks
description: Informal letter inviting a friend to a volunteer fair and an essay on four-day working weeks.

task1.title: Letter to a friend about a volunteer opportunity
task1.prompt: Your local community centre is hosting a volunteer fair next month, and you think your friend would be interested in taking part. Write a letter to your friend. In your letter: describe the event and its purpose, explain why you think your friend would enjoy it, and suggest how you could prepare together beforehand.
hints: Keep a warm and enthusiastic tone appropriate for a friend.
Include specific examples of volunteer activities on offer.
Suggest practical arrangements like transport or meeting times.

task2.title: Advantage-disadvantage essay — Four-day working weeks
task2.prompt: Some employers are experimenting with a four-day working week without reducing salaries. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this approach and give your own opinion.
outline: Introduction: outline the trend and indicate that you will weigh both sides.
Body paragraph 1: explore potential benefits for productivity, wellbeing, or recruitment.
Body paragraph 2: consider challenges such as coverage, cost, or customer service.
Conclusion: state your view and suggest conditions for implementing shorter weeks.
